 3207: 			self(), hd(erlang:ports()), [], [1,9,9,8],
 3208: 			{hejsan, "hejsan", [$h,"ejs",<<"an">>]}, 18446744073709551617),
 3209:     ok = check_is(hejsan, <<19,98>>, make_ref(), ok, fun() -> ok end,
 3210: 			self(), hd(erlang:ports()), [], [1,9,9,8],
 3211: 			{hejsan, "hejsan", [$h,"ejs",<<"an">>]}, -18446744073709551617),
 3212:     ok = check_is(hejsan, <<19,98>>, make_ref(), ok, fun() -> ok end,
 3213: 			self(), hd(erlang:ports()), [], [1,9,9,8],
 3214: 			{hejsan, "hejsan", [$h,"ejs",<<"an">>]}, 99.146),
 3215:     ok = check_is(hejsan, <<19,98>>, make_ref(), ok, fun() -> ok end,
 3216: 			self(), hd(erlang:ports()), [], [1,9,9,8],
 3217: 			{hejsan, "hejsan", [$h,"ejs",<<"an">>]}, -99.146),
 3218:     ok = check_is(hejsan, <<19,98>>, make_ref(), ok, fun() -> ok end,
 3219: 			self(), hd(erlang:ports()), [], [1,9,9,8],
 3220: 			{hejsan, "hejsan", [$h,"ejs",<<"an">>]}, 18446744073709551616.2e2),
 3221:     ok = check_is(hejsan, <<19,98>>, make_ref(), ok, fun() -> ok end,
 3222: 			self(), hd(erlang:ports()), [], [1,9,9,8],
 3223: 			{hejsan, "hejsan", [$h,"ejs",<<"an">>]}, -18446744073709551616.2e2),
 3224:     try
 3225:         check_is_exception(),
 3226:         throw(expected_badarg)
 3227:     catch
 3228:         error:badarg ->
 3229:             ok
 3230:     end.
 3231: 
 3232: %% Test all enif_get_length functions
 3233: get_length(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 3234:     ensure_lib_loaded(Config, 1),
 3235:     ok = length_test(hejsan, "hejsan", [], [], not_a_list, [1,2|3]).
 3236: 
 3237: ensure_lib_loaded(Config) ->
 3238:     ensure_lib_loaded(Config, 1).
 3239: ensure_lib_loaded(Config, Ver) ->
 3240:     Path = ?config(data_dir, Config),
 3241:     case lib_version() of
 3242:         undefined ->
 3243:             Lib = "nif_SUITE." ++ integer_to_list(Ver),
 3244:             ok = erlang:load_nif(filename:join(Path,Lib), []);
 3245:         Ver when is_integer(Ver) ->
 3246:             ok
 3247:     end,
 3248:     erl_ddll:try_load(Path, echo_drv, []),
 3249:     ok.
 3250: 
 3251: make_atom(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 3252:     ensure_lib_loaded(Config, 1),
 3253:     An0Atom = an0atom,
 3254:     An0Atom0 = 'an\000atom\000',
 3255:     Atoms = make_atoms(),
 3256:     7 = size(Atoms),
 3257:     Atoms = {An0Atom,An0Atom,An0Atom,An0Atom0,An0Atom,An0Atom,An0Atom0}.
 3258: 
 3259: make_string(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 3260:     ensure_lib_loaded(Config, 1),
 3261:     Strings = make_strings(),
 3262:     5 = size(Strings),
 3263:     A0String = "a0string",
 3264:     A0String0 = [$a,0,$s,$t,$r,$i,$n,$g,0],
 3265:     AStringWithAccents = [$E,$r,$l,$a,$n,$g,$ ,16#e4,$r,$ ,$e,$t,$t,$ ,$g,$e,$n,$e,$r,$e,$l,$l,$t,$ ,$p,$r,$o,$g,$r,$a,$m,$s,$p,$r,16#e5,$k],
 3266:     Strings = {A0String,A0String,A0String,A0String0, AStringWithAccents}.
 3267: 
 3268: reverse_list_test(Config) ->
 3269:     ensure_lib_loaded(Config, 1),
 3270:     List = lists:seq(1,100),
 3271:     RevList = lists:reverse(List),
 3272:     RevList = reverse_list(List),
 3273:     badarg = reverse_list(foo).
 3274: 
 3275: %% Memory leak of tmp-buffer when inspecting iolist or unaligned binary in unbound environment
 3276: otp_9668(Config) ->
 3277:     ensure_lib_loaded(Config, 1),
 3278:     TmpMem = tmpmem(),
 3279:     IOList = ["This",' ',<<"is">>,' ',[<<"an iolist">>,'.']],    
 3280:     otp_9668_nif(IOList),
 3281: 
 3282:     <<_:5/bitstring,UnalignedBin:10/binary,_/bitstring>> = <<"Abuse me as unaligned">>,
 3283:     otp_9668_nif(UnalignedBin),
 3284: 
 3285:     verify_tmpmem(TmpMem),
 3286:     ok.
 3287: 
 3288: %% Copy of writable binary
 3289: otp_9828(Config) ->
 3290:     ensure_lib_loaded(Config, 1),
 3291:     otp_9828_loop(<<"I'm alive!">>, 1000).
 3292: 
 3293: otp_9828_loop(_Bin, 0) ->
 3294:     ok;
 3295: otp_9828_loop(Bin, Val) ->
 3296:     WrtBin = <<Bin/binary, Val:32>>,
 3297:     ok = otp_9828_nif(WrtBin),
 3298:     otp_9828_loop(WrtBin, Val-1).
 3299: 
 3300: 
 3301: consume_timeslice(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 3302:     case {erlang:system_info(debug_compiled),
 3303: 	  erlang:system_info(lock_checking)} of
 3304: 	{false, false} ->
 3305: 	    consume_timeslice_test(Config);
 3306: 	{false, true} ->
 3307: 	    {skipped, "Lock checking enabled"};
 3308: 	_ ->
 3309: 	    {skipped, "Debug compiled"}
 3310:     end.
 3311: 
 3312: consume_timeslice_test(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 3313:     ensure_lib_loaded(Config),
 3314:     CONTEXT_REDS = 4000,
 3315:     Me = self(),
 3316:     Go = make_ref(),
 3317:     RedDiff = make_ref(),
 3318:     Done = make_ref(),
 3319:     DummyMFA = {?MODULE,dummy_call,1},
 3320:     P = spawn(fun () ->
 3321:                       receive Go -> ok end,
 3322:                       {reductions, R1} = process_info(self(), reductions),
 3323:                       1 = consume_timeslice_nif(100, false),
 3324:                       dummy_call(111),
 3325:                       0 = consume_timeslice_nif(90, false),
 3326:                       dummy_call(222),
 3327:                       1 = consume_timeslice_nif(10, false),
 3328:                       dummy_call(333),
 3329:                       0 = consume_timeslice_nif(25, false),
 3330:                       0 = consume_timeslice_nif(25, false),
 3331:                       0 = consume_timeslice_nif(25, false),
 3332:                       1 = consume_timeslice_nif(25, false),
 3333:                       0 = consume_timeslice_nif(25, false),
 3334: 
 3335:                       ok = case consume_timeslice_nif(1, true) of
 3336:                                Cnt when Cnt > 70, Cnt < 80 -> ok;
 3337:                                Other -> Other
 3338:                            end,
 3339:                       dummy_call(444),
 3340: 
 3341:                       {reductions, R2} = process_info(self(), reductions),
 3342:                       Me ! {RedDiff, R2 - R1},
 3343:                       exit(Done)
 3344:               end),
 3345:     erlang:yield(),
 3346: 
 3347:     erlang:trace_pattern(DummyMFA, [{'_', [], [{return_trace}]}], [local]),
 3348:     1 = erlang:trace(P, true, [call, running, procs, {tracer, self()}]),
 3349: 
 3350:     P ! Go,
 3351: 
 3352:     %% receive Go -> ok end,
 3353:     {trace, P, in, _} = next_tmsg(P),
 3354: 
 3355:     %% consume_timeslice_nif(100),
 3356:     %% dummy_call(111)
 3357:     %%
 3358:     %% Note that we may be scheduled out immediately before or immediately
 3359:     %% "after" dummy_call(111) depending on when the emulator tests reductions.
 3360:     %%
 3361:     %% In either case, we should be rescheduled before the function returns.
 3362:     Dummy_111 = {?MODULE,dummy_call,[111]},
 3363:     case next_tmsg(P) of
 3364:         {trace, P, out, _} ->
 3365:             %% See dummy_call(111) above
 3366:             {trace, P, in, _} = next_tmsg(P),
 3367:             {trace, P, call, Dummy_111} = next_tmsg(P);
 3368:         {trace, P, call, Dummy_111} ->
 3369:             {trace, P, out, _} = next_tmsg(P),
 3370:             {trace, P, in, _} = next_tmsg(P)
 3371:     end,
 3372:     {trace, P, return_from, DummyMFA, ok} = next_tmsg(P),
 3373: 
 3374:     %% consume_timeslice_nif(90),
 3375:     %% dummy_call(222)
 3376:     Dummy_222 = {?MODULE,dummy_call,[222]},
 3377:     {trace, P, call, Dummy_222} = next_tmsg(P),
 3378:     {trace, P, return_from, DummyMFA, ok} = next_tmsg(P),
 3379: 
 3380:     %% consume_timeslice_nif(10),
 3381:     %% dummy_call(333)
 3382:     Dummy_333 = {?MODULE,dummy_call,[333]},
 3383:     case next_tmsg(P) of
 3384:         {trace, P, out, _} ->
 3385:             %% See dummy_call(111) above
 3386:             {trace, P, in, _} = next_tmsg(P),
 3387:             {trace, P, call, Dummy_333} = next_tmsg(P);
 3388:         {trace, P, call, Dummy_333} ->
 3389:             {trace, P, out, _} = next_tmsg(P),
 3390:             {trace, P, in, _} = next_tmsg(P)
 3391:     end,
 3392:     {trace, P, return_from, DummyMFA, ok} = next_tmsg(P),
 3393: 
 3394:     %% 25,25,25,25, 25
 3395:     {trace, P, out, {?MODULE,consume_timeslice_nif,2}} = next_tmsg(P),
 3396:     {trace, P, in, {?MODULE,consume_timeslice_nif,2}} = next_tmsg(P),
 3397: 
 3398:     %% consume_timeslice(1,true)
 3399:     %% dummy_call(444)
 3400:     Dummy_444 = {?MODULE,dummy_call,[444]},
 3401:     case next_tmsg(P) of
 3402:         {trace, P, out, DummyMFA} ->
 3403:             %% See dummy_call(111) above
 3404:             {trace, P, in, DummyMFA} = next_tmsg(P),
 3405:             {trace, P, call, Dummy_444} = next_tmsg(P);
 3406:         {trace, P, call, Dummy_444} ->
 3407:             {trace, P, out, DummyMFA} = next_tmsg(P),
 3408:             {trace, P, in, DummyMFA} = next_tmsg(P)
 3409:     end,
 3410:     {trace, P, return_from, DummyMFA, ok} = next_tmsg(P),
 3411: 
 3412:     %% exit(Done)
 3413:     {trace, P, exit, Done} = next_tmsg(P),
 3414: 
 3415:     ExpReds = (100 + 90 + 10 + 25*5 + 75) * CONTEXT_REDS div 100,
 3416:     receive
 3417: 	{RedDiff, Reductions} when Reductions < (ExpReds + 10), Reductions > (ExpReds - 10) ->
 3418: 	    io:format("Reductions = ~p~n", [Reductions]),
 3419: 	    ok;
 3420: 	{RedDiff, Reductions} ->
 3421: 	    ct:fail({unexpected_reduction_count, Reductions, ExpReds})
 3422:     end,
 3423:     
 3424:     none = next_msg(P),
 3425: 
 3426:     ok.
 3427: 
 3428: nif_schedule(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 3429:     ensure_lib_loaded(Config),
 3430:     A = "this is a string",
 3431:     B = {this,is,a,tuple},
 3432:     {B,A} = call_nif_schedule(A, B),
 3433:     ok = try call_nif_schedule(1, 2)
 3434: 	 catch
 3435: 	     error:badarg:Stk ->
 3436: 		 [{?MODULE,call_nif_schedule,[1,2],_}|_] = Stk,
 3437: 		 ok
 3438: 	 end,
 3439:     ok.
 3440: 
 3441: nif_exception(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 3442:     ensure_lib_loaded(Config),
 3443:     try
 3444: 	%% this checks that the expected exception occurs when the NIF
 3445: 	%% calls enif_make_badarg at some point but then tries to return a
 3446: 	%% value that isn't an exception
 3447: 	call_nif_exception(0),
 3448: 	ct:fail(expected_badarg)
 3449:     catch
 3450: 	error:badarg ->
 3451: 	    ok
 3452:     end,
 3453:     %% this checks that a NIF can raise various terms as exceptions
 3454:     ok = nif_raise_exceptions(call_nif_exception),
 3455:     ok.
 3456: 
 3457: nif_nan_and_inf(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 3458:     ensure_lib_loaded(Config),
 3459:     try
 3460: 	call_nif_nan_or_inf(nan),
 3461: 	ct:fail(expected_badarg)
 3462:     catch
 3463: 	error:badarg ->
 3464: 	    ok
 3465:     end,
 3466:     try
 3467: 	call_nif_nan_or_inf(inf),
 3468: 	ct:fail(expected_badarg)
 3469:     catch
 3470: 	error:badarg ->
 3471: 	    ok
 3472:     end,
 3473:     try
 3474: 	call_nif_nan_or_inf(tuple),
 3475: 	ct:fail(expected_badarg)
 3476:     catch
 3477: 	error:badarg ->
 3478: 	    ok
 3479:     end.
 3480: 
 3481: nif_atom_too_long(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 3482:     ensure_lib_loaded(Config),
 3483:     try
 3484: 	call_nif_atom_too_long(all),
 3485: 	ct:fail(expected_badarg)
 3486:     catch
 3487: 	error:badarg ->
 3488: 	    ok
 3489:     end,
 3490:     try
 3491: 	call_nif_atom_too_long(len),
 3492: 	ct:fail(expected_badarg)
 3493:     catch
 3494: 	error:badarg ->
 3495: 	    ok
 3496:     end.
 3497: 
 3498: next_msg(_Pid) ->
 3499:     receive
 3500:         M -> M
 3501:     after 100 ->
 3502:               none
 3503:     end.
 3504: 
 3505: next_tmsg(Pid) ->    
 3506:     receive TMsg when is_tuple(TMsg),
 3507:                       element(1, TMsg) == trace,
 3508:                       element(2, TMsg) == Pid ->
 3509:                 TMsg
 3510:     after 100 ->
 3511:               none
 3512:     end.
 3513: 
 3514: dummy_call(_) ->    
 3515:     ok.
 3516: 
 3517: tmpmem() ->
 3518:     erts_debug:alloc_blocks_size(temp_alloc).
 3519: 
 3520: verify_tmpmem(MemInfo) ->
 3521:     %%wait_for_test_procs(),
 3522:     case tmpmem() of
 3523: 	MemInfo ->
 3524: 	    io:format("Tmp mem info: ~p", [MemInfo]),
 3525: 	    case MemInfo of
 3526: 		{notsup,undefined} ->
 3527: 		    %% Use 'erl +Mea max' to do more complete memory leak testing.
 3528: 		    {comment,"Incomplete or no mem leak testing"};
 3529: 		_ ->
 3530: 		    ok
 3531: 	    end;
 3532: 	Other ->
 3533:             ct:fail("Expected: ~p\nActual:   ~p", [MemInfo, Other])
 3534:     end.
 3535: 
 3536: call(Pid,Cmd) ->
 3537:     %%io:format("~p calling ~p with ~p\n",[self(), Pid, Cmd]),
 3538:     Pid ! {self(), Cmd},
 3539:     receive
 3540: 	{Pid,Reply} -> Reply
 3541:     end.
 3542: 
 3543: receive_any() ->
 3544:     receive M -> M end.	     
 3545: 
 3546: receive_any(Timeout) ->
 3547:     receive M -> M
 3548:     after Timeout -> timeout end.
 3549: 
 3550: receive_any_order([]) -> ok;
 3551: receive_any_order(Expected) ->
 3552:     M = receive_any(),
 3553:     case lists:member(M, Expected) of
 3554:         true ->
 3555:             receive_any_order(lists:delete(M, Expected));
 3556:         false ->
 3557:             io:format("Expected any of ~p", Expected),
 3558:             io:format("Received ~p", M),
 3559:             ct:fail({unexpected, M})
 3560:     end.
 3561: 
 3562: 
 3563: flush() ->
 3564:     flush(1).
 3565: 
 3566: flush(0) ->
 3567:     flush(0, 10);  % don't waste too much time waiting for nothing
 3568: flush(N) ->
 3569:     flush(N, 1000).
 3570: 
 3571: flush(N, Timeout) ->
 3572:     receive M ->
 3573:             [M | flush(N-1)]
 3574:     after Timeout ->
 3575:             []
 3576:     end.
 3577: 
 3578: repeat(0, _, Arg) ->
 3579:     Arg;
 3580: repeat(N, Fun, Arg0) ->
 3581:     repeat(N-1, Fun, Fun(Arg0)).
 3582: 
 3583: repeat_while(Fun, Acc0) ->
 3584:     case Fun(Acc0) of
 3585:         false -> ok;
 3586:         Acc1 ->
 3587:             repeat_while(Fun, Acc1)
 3588:     end.
 3589: 
 3590: check(Exp,Got,Line) ->
 3591:     case Got of
 3592:  	Exp -> Exp;	    
 3593:   	_ ->
 3594: 	    io:format("CHECK at line ~p\nExpected: ~p\nGot     : ~p\n",
 3595:                       [Line,Exp,Got]),
 3596:  	    Got
 3597:     end.
 3598: 
 3599: nif_raise_exceptions(NifFunc) ->
 3600:     ExcTerms = [{error, test}, "a string", <<"a binary">>,
 3601:                 42, [1,2,3,4,5], [{p,1},{p,2},{p,3}]],
 3602:     lists:foldl(fun(Term, ok) ->
 3603:                         try
 3604:                             erlang:apply(?MODULE,NifFunc,[Term]),
 3605:                             ct:fail({expected,Term})
 3606:                         catch
 3607:                             error:Term:Stk ->
 3608:                                 [{?MODULE,NifFunc,[Term],_}|_] = Stk,
 3609:                                 ok
 3610:                         end
 3611:                 end, ok, ExcTerms).
 3612: 
 3613: -define(ERL_NIF_TIME_ERROR, -9223372036854775808).
 3614: -define(TIME_UNITS, [second, millisecond, microsecond, nanosecond]).
 3615: 
 3616: nif_monotonic_time(_Config) ->
 3617:     ?ERL_NIF_TIME_ERROR = monotonic_time(invalid_time_unit),
 3618:     mtime_loop(1000000).
 3619: 
 3620: mtime_loop(0) ->
 3621:     ok;
 3622: mtime_loop(N) ->
 3623:     chk_mtime(?TIME_UNITS),
 3624:     mtime_loop(N-1).
 3625: 
 3626: chk_mtime([]) ->
 3627:     ok;
 3628: chk_mtime([TU|TUs]) ->
 3629:     A = erlang:monotonic_time(TU),
 3630:     B = monotonic_time(TU),
 3631:     C = erlang:monotonic_time(TU),
 3632:     try
 3633: 	true = A =< B,
 3634: 	true = B =< C
 3635:     catch
 3636: 	_ : _ ->
 3637: 	    ct:fail({monotonic_time_missmatch, TU, A, B, C})
 3638:     end,
 3639:     chk_mtime(TUs).
 3640: 
 3641: nif_time_offset(_Config) ->
 3642:     ?ERL_NIF_TIME_ERROR = time_offset(invalid_time_unit),
 3643:     toffs_loop(1000000).
 3644: 
 3645: toffs_loop(0) ->
 3646:     ok;
 3647: toffs_loop(N) ->
 3648:     chk_toffs(?TIME_UNITS),
 3649:     toffs_loop(N-1).
 3650: 
 3651: chk_toffs([]) ->
 3652:     ok;
 3653: chk_toffs([TU|TUs]) ->
 3654:     TO = erlang:time_offset(TU),
 3655:     NifTO = time_offset(TU),
 3656:     case TO =:= NifTO of
 3657:         true ->
 3658:             ok;
 3659:         false ->
 3660:             case erlang:system_info(time_warp_mode) of
 3661:                 no_time_warp ->
 3662:                     ct:fail({time_offset_mismatch, TU, TO, NifTO});
 3663:                 _ ->
 3664:                     %% Most frequent time offset change
 3665:                     %% is currently only every 15:th
 3666:                     %% second so this should currently
 3667:                     %% work...
 3668:                     NTO = erlang:time_offset(TU),
 3669:                     case NifTO =:= NTO of
 3670:                         true ->
 3671:                             ok;
 3672:                         false ->
 3673:                             ct:fail({time_offset_mismatch, TU, TO, NifTO, NTO})
 3674:                     end
 3675:             end
 3676:     end,
 3677:     chk_toffs(TUs).
 3678: 
 3679: nif_convert_time_unit(_Config) ->
 3680:     ?ERL_NIF_TIME_ERROR = convert_time_unit(0, second, invalid_time_unit),
 3681:     ?ERL_NIF_TIME_ERROR = convert_time_unit(0, invalid_time_unit, second),
 3682:     ?ERL_NIF_TIME_ERROR = convert_time_unit(0, invalid_time_unit, invalid_time_unit),
 3683:     lists:foreach(fun (Offset) ->
 3684:                           lists:foreach(fun (Diff) ->
 3685:                                                 chk_ctu(Diff+(Offset*1000*1000*1000))
 3686:                                         end,
 3687:                                         [999999999999,
 3688:                                          99999999999,
 3689:                                          9999999999,
 3690:                                          999999999,
 3691:                                          99999999,
 3692:                                          9999999,
 3693:                                          999999,
 3694:                                          99999,
 3695:                                          999,
 3696:                                          99,
 3697:                                          9,
 3698:                                          1,
 3699:                                          11,
 3700:                                          101,
 3701:                                          1001,
 3702:                                          10001,
 3703:                                          100001,
 3704:                                          1000001,
 3705:                                          10000001,
 3706:                                          100000001,
 3707:                                          1000000001,
 3708:                                          100000000001,
 3709:                                          1000000000001,
 3710:                                          5,
 3711:                                          50,
 3712:                                          500,
 3713:                                          5000,
 3714:                                          50000,
 3715:                                          500000,
 3716:                                          5000000,
 3717:                                          50000000,
 3718:                                          500000000,
 3719:                                          5000000000,
 3720:                                          50000000000,
 3721:                                          500000000000])
 3722:                   end,
 3723:                   [-4711, -1000, -475, -5, -4, -3, -2, -1, 0,
 3724:                    1, 2, 3, 4, 5, 475, 1000, 4711]),
 3725:     ctu_loop(1000000).
 3726: 
 3727: ctu_loop(0) ->
 3728:     ok;
 3729: ctu_loop(N) ->
 3730:     chk_ctu(erlang:monotonic_time(nanosecond)),
 3731:     ctu_loop(N-1).
 3732: 
 3733: chk_ctu(Time) ->
 3734:     chk_ctu(Time, ?TIME_UNITS).
 3735: 
 3736: chk_ctu(_Time, []) ->
 3737:     ok;
 3738: chk_ctu(Time, [FromTU|FromTUs]) ->
 3739:     chk_ctu(Time, FromTU, ?TIME_UNITS),
 3740:     chk_ctu(Time, FromTUs).
 3741: 
 3742: chk_ctu(_Time, _FromTU, []) ->
 3743:     ok;
 3744: chk_ctu(Time, FromTU, [ToTU|ToTUs]) ->
 3745:     T = erlang:convert_time_unit(Time, nanosecond, FromTU),
 3746:     TE = erlang:convert_time_unit(T, FromTU, ToTU),
 3747:     TN = convert_time_unit(T, FromTU, ToTU),
 3748:     case TE =:= TN of
 3749: 	false ->
 3750: 	    ct:fail({conversion_mismatch, FromTU, T, ToTU, TE, TN});
 3751: 	true ->
 3752: 	    chk_ctu(Time, FromTU, ToTUs)
 3753:     end.
 3754: 
 3755: nif_now_time(Config) ->
 3756:     ensure_lib_loaded(Config),
 3757: 
 3758:     N1 = now(),
 3759:     NifN1 = now_time(),
 3760:     NifN2 = now_time(),
 3761:     N2 = now(),
 3762:     true = N1 < NifN1,
 3763:     true = NifN1 < NifN2,
 3764:     true = NifN2 < N2.
 3765: 
 3766: nif_cpu_time(Config) ->
 3767:     ensure_lib_loaded(Config),
 3768: 
 3769:     try cpu_time() of
 3770:         {_, _, _} ->
 3771:             ok
 3772:     catch error:badarg ->
 3773:             {comment, "cpu_time not supported"}
 3774:     end.
 3775: 
 3776: nif_unique_integer(Config) ->
 3777:     ensure_lib_loaded(Config),
 3778: 
 3779:     UM1 = erlang:unique_integer([monotonic]),
 3780:     UM2 = unique_integer_nif([monotonic]),
 3781:     UM3 = erlang:unique_integer([monotonic]),
 3782: 
 3783:     true = UM1 < UM2,
 3784:     true = UM2 < UM3,
 3785: 
 3786:     UMP1 = erlang:unique_integer([monotonic, positive]),
 3787:     UMP2 = unique_integer_nif([monotonic, positive]),
 3788:     UMP3 = erlang:unique_integer([monotonic, positive]),
 3789: 
 3790:     true = 0 =< UMP1,
 3791:     true = UMP1 < UMP2,
 3792:     true = UMP2 < UMP3,
 3793: 
 3794:     UP1 = erlang:unique_integer([positive]),
 3795:     UP2 = unique_integer_nif([positive]),
 3796:     UP3 = erlang:unique_integer([positive]),
 3797: 
 3798:     true = 0 =< UP1,
 3799:     true = 0 =< UP2,
 3800:     true = 0 =< UP3,
 3801: 
 3802:     true = is_integer(unique_integer_nif([])),
 3803:     true = is_integer(unique_integer_nif([])),
 3804:     true = is_integer(unique_integer_nif([])).
 3805: 
 3806: nif_is_process_alive(Config) ->
 3807:     ensure_lib_loaded(Config),
 3808: 
 3809:     {Pid,_} = spawn_monitor(fun() -> receive ok -> nok end end),
 3810:     true = is_process_alive_nif(Pid),
 3811:     exit(Pid, die),
 3812:     receive _ -> ok end, %% Clear monitor
 3813:     false = is_process_alive_nif(Pid).
 3814: 
 3815: nif_is_port_alive(Config) ->
 3816:     ensure_lib_loaded(Config),
 3817: 
 3818:     Port = open_port({spawn,echo_drv},[eof]),
 3819:     true = is_port_alive_nif(Port),
 3820:     port_close(Port),
 3821:     false = is_port_alive_nif(Port).
 3822: 
 3823: nif_term_to_binary(Config) ->
 3824:     ensure_lib_loaded(Config),
 3825:     T = {#{ok => nok}, <<0:8096>>, lists:seq(1,100)},
 3826:     Bin = term_to_binary(T),
 3827:     ct:log("~p",[Bin]),
 3828:     Bin = term_to_binary_nif(T, undefined),
 3829:     true = term_to_binary_nif(T, self()),
 3830:     receive Bin -> ok end.
 3831: 
 3832: -define(ERL_NIF_BIN2TERM_SAFE, 16#20000000).
 3833: 
 3834: nif_binary_to_term(Config) ->
 3835:     ensure_lib_loaded(Config),
 3836:     BigMap = maps:from_list([{I,-I} || I <- lists:seq(1,100)]),
 3837:     [nif_binary_to_term_do(T)
 3838:      || T <- [{#{ok => nok}, <<0:8096>>, lists:seq(1,100)},
 3839:               atom, 42, self(), BigMap]],
 3840:     ok.
 3841: 
 3842: nif_binary_to_term_do(T) ->
 3843:     Dummy = [true|false],
 3844:     Bin = term_to_binary(T),
 3845:     Len = byte_size(Bin),
 3846:     {Len,T,Dummy} = binary_to_term_nif(Bin, undefined, 0),
 3847:     Len = binary_to_term_nif(Bin, self(), 0),
 3848:     {T,Dummy} = receive M -> M after 1000 -> timeout end,
 3849: 
 3850:     {Len,T,Dummy} = binary_to_term_nif(Bin, undefined, ?ERL_NIF_BIN2TERM_SAFE),
 3851:     false = binary_to_term_nif(<<131,100,0,14,"undefined_atom">>,
 3852:                                undefined, ?ERL_NIF_BIN2TERM_SAFE),
 3853:     false = binary_to_term_nif(Bin, undefined, 1),
 3854:     ok.
 3855: 
 3856: nif_port_command(Config) ->
 3857:     ensure_lib_loaded(Config),
 3858: 
 3859:     Port = open_port({spawn,echo_drv},[eof]),
 3860:     true = port_command_nif(Port, "hello\n"),
 3861:     receive {Port,{data,"hello\n"}} -> ok
 3862:     after 1000 -> ct:fail(timeout) end,
 3863: 
 3864:     RefcBin = lists:flatten([lists:duplicate(100, "hello"),"\n"]),
 3865:     true = port_command_nif(Port, iolist_to_binary(RefcBin)),
 3866:     receive {Port,{data,RefcBin}} -> ok
 3867:     after 1000 -> ct:fail(timeout) end,
 3868: 
 3869:     %% Test that invalid arguments correctly returns
 3870:     %% badarg and that the port survives.
 3871:     {'EXIT', {badarg, _}} = (catch port_command_nif(Port, [ok])),
 3872: 
 3873:     IoList = [lists:duplicate(100,<<"hello">>),"\n"],
 3874:     true = port_command_nif(Port, [IoList]),
 3875:     FlatIoList = binary_to_list(iolist_to_binary(IoList)),
 3876:     receive {Port,{data,FlatIoList}} -> ok
 3877:     after 1000 -> ct:fail(timeout) end,
 3878: 
 3879:     port_close(Port),
 3880: 
 3881:     {'EXIT', {badarg, _}} = (catch port_command_nif(Port, "hello\n")),
 3882:     ok.
 3883: 
 3884: nif_snprintf(Config) ->
 3885:     ensure_lib_loaded(Config),
 3886:     <<"ok",0>> = format_term_nif(3,ok),
 3887:     <<"o",0>>  = format_term_nif(2,ok),
 3888:     <<"\"hello world\"",0>> = format_term_nif(14,"hello world"),
 3889:     <<"{{hello,world,-33},3.14",_/binary>> = format_term_nif(50,{{hello,world, -33}, 3.14, self()}),
 3890:     <<"{{hello,world,-33},",0>> = format_term_nif(20,{{hello,world, -33}, 3.14, self()}),
 3891:     ok.
 3892: 
 3893: nif_internal_hash(Config) ->
 3894:     ensure_lib_loaded(Config),
 3895:     HashValueBitSize = nif_hash_result_bitsize(internal),
 3896:     Terms = unique([random_term() || _ <- lists:seq(1, 500)]),
 3897:     HashValues = [hash_nif(internal, Term, 0) || Term <- Terms],
 3898:     test_bit_distribution_fitness(HashValues, HashValueBitSize).
 3899: 
 3900: nif_internal_hash_salted(Config) ->
 3901:     ensure_lib_loaded(Config),
 3902:     test_salted_nif_hash(internal).
 3903: 
 3904: nif_phash2(Config) ->
 3905:     ensure_lib_loaded(Config),
 3906:     HashValueBitSize = nif_hash_result_bitsize(phash2),
 3907:     Terms = unique([random_term() || _ <- lists:seq(1, 500)]),
 3908:     HashValues =
 3909:         lists:map(
 3910:           fun (Term) ->
 3911:                   HashValue = erlang:phash2(Term),
 3912:                   Salt = random_uint32(), % phash2 should ignore salt
 3913:                   NifHashValue = hash_nif(phash2, Term, Salt),
 3914:                   (HashValue =:= NifHashValue
 3915:                    orelse ct:fail("Expected: ~p\nActual:   ~p",
 3916:                                   [HashValue, NifHashValue])),
 3917:                   HashValue
 3918:           end,
 3919:           Terms),
 3920:     test_bit_distribution_fitness(HashValues, HashValueBitSize).
 3921: 
 3922: test_salted_nif_hash(HashType) ->
 3923:     HashValueBitSize = nif_hash_result_bitsize(HashType),
 3924:     Terms = unique([random_term() || _ <- lists:seq(1, 500)]),
 3925:     Salts = unique([random_uint32() || _ <- lists:seq(1, 50)]),
 3926:     {HashValuesPerSalt, HashValuesPerTerm} =
 3927:         lists:mapfoldl(
 3928:           fun (Salt, Acc) ->
 3929:                   {HashValues, NewAcc} =
 3930:                     lists:mapfoldl(
 3931:                       fun (Term, AccB) ->
 3932:                               HashValue = hash_nif(HashType, Term, Salt),
 3933:                               NewAccB = dict:append(Term, HashValue, AccB),
 3934:                               {HashValue, NewAccB}
 3935:                       end,
 3936:                       Acc,
 3937:                       Terms),
 3938:                   {{Salt, HashValues}, NewAcc}
 3939:           end,
 3940:           dict:new(),
 3941:           Salts),
 3942: 
 3943:     % Test per-salt hash distribution of different terms
 3944:     lists:foreach(
 3945:       fun ({_Salt, HashValues}) ->
 3946:               test_bit_distribution_fitness(HashValues, HashValueBitSize)
 3947:       end,
 3948:       HashValuesPerSalt),
 3949: 
 3950:     % Test per-term hash distribution of different salts
 3951:     dict:fold(
 3952:       fun (_Term, HashValues, Acc) ->
 3953:               test_bit_distribution_fitness(HashValues, HashValueBitSize),
 3954:               Acc
 3955:       end,
 3956:       ok,
 3957:       HashValuesPerTerm).
 3958: 
 3959: test_bit_distribution_fitness(Integers, BitSize) ->
 3960:     MaxInteger = (1 bsl BitSize) - 1,
 3961:     OnesPerBit =
 3962:         lists:foldl(
 3963:           fun (Integer, Acc) when Integer >= 0, Integer =< MaxInteger ->
 3964:                   lists:foldl(
 3965:                     fun (BitIndex, AccB) ->
 3966:                             BitValue = (Integer band (1 bsl BitIndex)) bsr BitIndex,
 3967:                             orddict:update_counter(BitIndex, BitValue, AccB)
 3968:                     end,
 3969:                     Acc,
 3970:                     lists:seq(0, BitSize - 1))
 3971:           end,
 3972:           orddict:new(),
 3973:           Integers),
 3974: 
 3975:     N = length(Integers),
 3976:     ExpectedNrOfOnes = N div 2,
 3977:     %% ExpectedNrOfOnes should have a binomial distribution
 3978:     %% with a standard deviation as:
 3979:     ExpectedStdDev = math:sqrt(N) / 2,
 3980:     %% which can be approximated as a normal distribution
 3981:     %% where we allow a deviation of 6 std.devs
 3982:     %% for a fail probability of 0.000000002:
 3983:     MaxStdDevs = 6,
 3984: 
 3985:     FailureText =
 3986:         orddict:fold(
 3987:           fun (BitIndex, NrOfOnes, Acc) ->
 3988:                   Deviation = abs(NrOfOnes - ExpectedNrOfOnes) / ExpectedStdDev,
 3989:                   case Deviation >= MaxStdDevs of
 3990:                       false ->
 3991:                           Acc;
 3992:                       true ->
 3993:                           [Acc,
 3994:                            io_lib:format(
 3995:                              "Unreasonable deviation on number of set bits (i=~p): "
 3996:                              "expected ~p, got ~p (# std.dev ~.3f > ~p)~n",
 3997:                              [BitIndex, ExpectedNrOfOnes, NrOfOnes, Deviation, MaxStdDevs])]
 3998:                   end
 3999:           end,
 4000:           [],
 4001:           OnesPerBit),
 4002: 
 4003:     (FailureText =:= [] orelse ct:fail(FailureText)).
 4004: 
 4005: nif_hash_result_bitsize(internal) -> erlang:system_info(wordsize) * 8;
 4006: nif_hash_result_bitsize(phash2) -> 27.
 4007: 
 4008: unique(List) ->
 4009:     lists:usort(List).
 4010: 
 4011: random_uint32() ->
 4012:     rand:uniform(1 bsl 32) - 1.
 4013: 
 4014: random_term() ->
 4015:     case rand:uniform(6) of
 4016:         1 -> rand:uniform(1 bsl 27) - 1; % small
 4017:         2 -> (1 bsl 27) + rand:uniform(1 bsl 128); % big
 4018:         3 -> random_sign() * (rand:uniform() * (1 bsl 53)); % float
 4019:         4 -> random_binary();
 4020:         5 -> random_pid();
 4021:         6 ->
 4022:             Length = rand:uniform(10),
 4023:             List = [random_term() || _ <- lists:seq(1, Length)],
 4024:             case rand:uniform(2) of
 4025:                 1 ->
 4026:                    List;
 4027:                 2 ->
 4028:                    list_to_tuple(List)
 4029:             end
 4030:     end.
 4031: 
 4032: random_sign() ->
 4033:     case rand:uniform(2) of
 4034:         1 -> -1.0;
 4035:         2 -> 1.0
 4036:     end.
 4037: 
 4038: random_binary() ->
 4039:     rand:bytes(rand:uniform(32) - 1).
 4040: 
 4041: random_pid() ->
 4042:     Processes = erlang:processes(),
 4043:     lists:nth(rand:uniform(length(Processes)), Processes).
 4044: 
 4045: %% Test enif_whereis_...
 4046: 
 4047: nif_whereis(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 4048:     ensure_lib_loaded(Config),
 4049: 
 4050:     RegName = nif_whereis_test_thing,
 4051:     undefined = erlang:whereis(RegName),
 4052:     false = whereis_term(pid, RegName),
 4053: 
 4054:     Mgr = self(),
 4055:     Ref = make_ref(),
 4056:     ProcMsg = {Ref, ?LINE},
 4057:     PortMsg = ?MODULE_STRING " whereis hello\n",
 4058: 
 4059:     {Pid, Mon} = spawn_monitor(?MODULE, nif_whereis_proxy, [Ref]),
 4060:     true = register(RegName, Pid),
 4061:     Pid = erlang:whereis(RegName),
 4062:     Pid = whereis_term(pid, RegName),
 4063:     false = whereis_term(port, RegName),
 4064:     false = whereis_term(pid, [RegName]),
 4065: 
 4066:     ok = whereis_send(pid, RegName, {forward, Mgr, ProcMsg}),
 4067:     ok = receive ProcMsg -> ok end,
 4068: 
 4069:     Pid ! {Ref, quit},
 4070:     ok = receive {'DOWN', Mon, process, Pid, normal} -> ok end,
 4071:     undefined = erlang:whereis(RegName),
 4072:     false = whereis_term(pid, RegName),
 4073: 
 4074:     Port = open_port({spawn, echo_drv}, [eof]),
 4075:     true = register(RegName, Port),
 4076:     Port = erlang:whereis(RegName),
 4077:     Port = whereis_term(port, RegName),
 4078:     false = whereis_term(pid, RegName),
 4079:     false = whereis_term(port, [RegName]),
 4080: 
 4081:     ok = whereis_send(port, RegName, PortMsg),
 4082:     ok = receive {Port, {data, PortMsg}} -> ok end,
 4083: 
 4084:     port_close(Port),
 4085:     undefined = erlang:whereis(RegName),
 4086:     false = whereis_term(port, RegName),
 4087:     ok.
 4088: 
 4089: nif_whereis_parallel(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 4090:     ensure_lib_loaded(Config),
 4091: 
 4092:     %% try to be at least a little asymmetric
 4093:     NProcs = trunc(3.7 * erlang:system_info(schedulers)),
 4094:     NSeq = lists:seq(1, NProcs),
 4095:     Names = [list_to_atom("nif_whereis_proc_" ++ integer_to_list(N))
 4096:             || N <- NSeq],
 4097:     Mgr = self(),
 4098:     Ref = make_ref(),
 4099: 
 4100:     NotReg = fun(Name) ->
 4101:         erlang:whereis(Name) == undefined
 4102:     end,
 4103:     PidReg = fun({Name, Pid, _Mon}) ->
 4104:         erlang:whereis(Name) == Pid andalso whereis_term(pid, Name) == Pid
 4105:     end,
 4106:     RecvDown = fun({_Name, Pid, Mon}) ->
 4107:         receive {'DOWN', Mon, process, Pid, normal} -> true
 4108:         after   1500 -> false end
 4109:     end,
 4110:     RecvNum = fun(N) ->
 4111:         receive {N, Ref} -> true
 4112:         after   1500 -> false end
 4113:     end,
 4114: 
 4115:     true = lists:all(NotReg, Names),
 4116: 
 4117:     %% {Name, Pid, Mon}
 4118:     Procs = lists:map(
 4119:         fun(N) ->
 4120:             Name = lists:nth(N, Names),
 4121:             Prev = lists:nth((if N == 1 -> NProcs; true -> (N - 1) end), Names),
 4122:             Next = lists:nth((if N == NProcs -> 1; true -> (N + 1) end), Names),
 4123:             {Pid, Mon} = spawn_monitor(
 4124:                 ?MODULE, nif_whereis_proxy, [{N, Ref, Mgr, [Prev, Next]}]),
 4125:             true = register(Name, Pid),
 4126:             {Name, Pid, Mon}
 4127:         end, NSeq),
 4128: 
 4129:     true = lists:all(PidReg, Procs),
 4130: 
 4131:     %% tell them all to 'fire' as fast as we can
 4132:     repeat(10, fun(_) ->
 4133:                        [P ! {Ref, send_proc} || {_, P, _} <- Procs]
 4134:                end, void),
 4135: 
 4136:     %% each gets forwarded through two processes
 4137:     repeat(10, fun(_) ->
 4138:                        true = lists:all(RecvNum, NSeq),
 4139:                        true = lists:all(RecvNum, NSeq)
 4140:                end, void),
 4141: 
 4142:     %% tell them all to 'quit' by name
 4143:     [N ! {Ref, quit} || {N, _, _} <- Procs],
 4144:     true = lists:all(RecvDown, Procs),
 4145:     true = lists:all(NotReg, Names),
 4146:     ok.
 4147: 
 4148: nif_whereis_threaded(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 4149:     ensure_lib_loaded(Config),
 4150: 
 4151:     RegName = nif_whereis_test_threaded,
 4152:     undefined = erlang:whereis(RegName),
 4153: 
 4154:     Self = self(),
 4155:     true = register(RegName, Self),
 4156: 
 4157:     {ok, ProcThr} = whereis_thd_lookup(pid, RegName, "dtor to proc"),
 4158:     {ok, Self} = whereis_thd_result(ProcThr),
 4159: 
 4160:     nif_whereis_threaded_2(RegName).
 4161: 
 4162: nif_whereis_threaded_2(RegName) ->
 4163:     erlang:garbage_collect(),
 4164:     "dtor to proc" = receive_any(1000),
 4165:     true = unregister(RegName),
 4166: 
 4167:     Port = open_port({spawn, echo_drv}, [eof]),
 4168:     true = register(RegName, Port),
 4169: 
 4170:     {ok, PortThr} = whereis_thd_lookup(port, RegName, "dtor to port"),
 4171:     {ok, Port} = whereis_thd_result(PortThr),
 4172: 
 4173:     nif_whereis_threaded_3(Port).
 4174: 
 4175: nif_whereis_threaded_3(Port) ->
 4176:     erlang:garbage_collect(),
 4177:     {Port, {data, "dtor to port"}} = receive_any(1000),
 4178: 
 4179:     port_close(Port),
 4180:     ok.
 4181: 
 4182: %% exported to be spawned by MFA by whereis tests
 4183: nif_whereis_proxy({N, Ref, Mgr, Targets} = Args) ->
 4184:     receive
 4185:         {forward, To, Data} ->
 4186:             To ! Data,
 4187:             nif_whereis_proxy(Args);
 4188:         {Ref, quit} ->
 4189:             ok;
 4190:         {Ref, send_port} ->
 4191:             Msg = ?MODULE_STRING " whereis " ++ integer_to_list(N) ++ "\n",
 4192:             lists:foreach(
 4193:                 fun(T) ->
 4194:                     ok = whereis_send(port, T, Msg)
 4195:                 end, Targets),
 4196:             nif_whereis_proxy(Args);
 4197:         {Ref, send_proc} ->
 4198:             lists:foreach(
 4199:                 fun(T) ->
 4200:                     ok = whereis_send(pid, T, {forward, Mgr, {N, Ref}})
 4201:                 end, Targets),
 4202:             nif_whereis_proxy(Args)
 4203:     end;
 4204: nif_whereis_proxy(Ref) ->
 4205:     receive
 4206:         {forward, To, Data} ->
 4207:             To ! Data,
 4208:             nif_whereis_proxy(Ref);
 4209:         {Ref, quit} ->
 4210:             ok
 4211:     end.
 4212: nif_ioq(Config) ->
 4213:     ensure_lib_loaded(Config),
 4214: 
 4215:     Script =
 4216:         [{create, a},
 4217: 
 4218:          %% Test enq of erlang term binary
 4219:          {enqb,   a},
 4220:          {enqb,   a, 3},
 4221: 
 4222:          %% Test enq of non-erlang term binary
 4223:          {enqbraw,a},
 4224:          {enqbraw,a, 5},
 4225:          {peek,   a},
 4226:          {peek_head,  a},
 4227:          {deq,    a, 42},
 4228: 
 4229:          %% Test enqv
 4230:          {enqv,   a, 2, 100},
 4231:          {peek_head,  a},
 4232:          {deq,    a, all},
 4233: 
 4234:          %% This skips all elements but one in the iolist
 4235:          {enqv,   a, 5, iolist_size(nif_ioq_payload(5)) - 1},
 4236:          {peek_head,  a},
 4237:          {peek,   a},
 4238: 
 4239:          %% Ensure that enqueued refc binaries are intact after a roundtrip.
 4240:          %%
 4241:          %% This test and the ones immediately following it does not go through
 4242:          %% erlang:iolist_to_iovec/1
 4243:          {enqv,   a, [nif_ioq_payload(refcbin) || _ <- lists:seq(1,20)], 0},
 4244:          {peek,   a},
 4245: 
 4246:          %% ... heap binaries
 4247:          {enqv,   a, [nif_ioq_payload(heapbin) || _ <- lists:seq(1,20)], 0},
 4248:          {peek,   a},
 4249: 
 4250:          %% ... plain sub-binaries
 4251:          {enqv,   a, [nif_ioq_payload(subbin) || _ <- lists:seq(1,20)], 0},
 4252:          {peek,   a},
 4253: 
 4254:          %% ... unaligned binaries
 4255:          {enqv,   a, [nif_ioq_payload(unaligned_bin) || _ <- lists:seq(1,20)], 0},
 4256:          {peek,   a},
 4257: 
 4258:          %% Enq stuff to destroy with data in queue
 4259:          {enqv,   a, 2, 100},
 4260:          {destroy,a},
 4261: 
 4262:          %% Test destroy of new queue
 4263:          {create, a},
 4264:          {destroy,a}
 4265:         ],
 4266: 
 4267:     nif_ioq_run(Script),
 4268: 
 4269:     %% Test that only enif_inspect_as_vec works
 4270:     Payload = nif_ioq_payload(5),
 4271:     PayloadBin = iolist_to_binary(Payload),
 4272: 
 4273:     [begin
 4274:          PayloadBin = iolist_to_binary(ioq_nif(inspect,Payload,Stack,Env)),
 4275:          <<>>       = iolist_to_binary(ioq_nif(inspect,[],Stack,Env))
 4276:      end || Stack <- [no_stack, use_stack], Env <- [use_env, no_env]],
 4277: 
 4278:     %% Test error cases
 4279: 
 4280:     Q = ioq_nif(create),
 4281: 
 4282:     false = ioq_nif(peek_head, Q),
 4283: 
 4284:     {'EXIT', {badarg, _}} = (catch ioq_nif(deq, Q, 1)),
 4285:     {'EXIT', {badarg, _}} = (catch ioq_nif(enqv, Q, 1, 1234)),
 4286: 
 4287:     false = ioq_nif(peek_head, Q),
 4288: 
 4289:     {'EXIT', {badarg, _}} = (catch ioq_nif(enqv, Q, [atom_in_list], 0)),
 4290:     {'EXIT', {badarg, _}} = (catch ioq_nif(enqv, Q, [make_ref()], 0)),
 4291:     {'EXIT', {badarg, _}} = (catch ioq_nif(enqv, Q, [256], 0)),
 4292:     {'EXIT', {badarg, _}} = (catch ioq_nif(enqv, Q, [-1], 0)),
 4293:     {'EXIT', {badarg, _}} = (catch ioq_nif(enqv, Q, [#{}], 0)),
 4294:     {'EXIT', {badarg, _}} = (catch ioq_nif(enqv, Q, [1 bsl 64], 0)),
 4295:     {'EXIT', {badarg, _}} = (catch ioq_nif(enqv, Q, [{tuple}], 0)),
 4296: 
 4297:     false = ioq_nif(peek_head, Q),
 4298: 
 4299:     {'EXIT', {badarg, _}} = (catch ioq_nif(inspect,  [atom_in_list], use_stack)),
 4300:     {'EXIT', {badarg, _}} = (catch ioq_nif(inspect,  [make_ref()], no_stack)),
 4301:     {'EXIT', {badarg, _}} = (catch ioq_nif(inspect,  [256], use_stack)),
 4302:     {'EXIT', {badarg, _}} = (catch ioq_nif(inspect,  [-1], no_stack)),
 4303:     {'EXIT', {badarg, _}} = (catch ioq_nif(inspect,  [#{}], use_stack)),
 4304:     {'EXIT', {badarg, _}} = (catch ioq_nif(inspect,  [1 bsl 64], no_stack)),
 4305:     {'EXIT', {badarg, _}} = (catch ioq_nif(inspect,  [{tuple}], use_stack)),
 4306:     {'EXIT', {badarg, _}} = (catch ioq_nif(inspect,  <<"binary">>, use_stack)),
 4307: 
 4308:     ioq_nif(destroy, Q),
 4309: 
 4310:     %% Test that the example in the docs works
 4311:     ExampleQ = ioq_nif(create),
 4312:     true = ioq_nif(example, ExampleQ, nif_ioq_payload(5)),
 4313:     ioq_nif(destroy, ExampleQ),
 4314: 
 4315:     ok.
 4316: 
 4317: 
 4318: nif_ioq_run(Script) ->
 4319:     nif_ioq_run(Script, #{}).
 4320: 
 4321: nif_ioq_run([{Action, Name}|T], State)
 4322:   when Action =:= enqb; Action =:= enqbraw ->
 4323:     nif_ioq_run([{Action, Name, heapbin}|T], State);
 4324: nif_ioq_run([{Action, Name, Skip}|T], State)
 4325:   when Action =:= enqb, is_integer(Skip);
 4326:        Action =:= enqbraw, is_integer(Skip) ->
 4327:     nif_ioq_run([{Action, Name, heapbin, Skip}|T], State);
 4328: nif_ioq_run([{Action, Name, N}|T], State)
 4329:   when Action =:= enqv; Action =:= enqb; Action =:= enqbraw ->
 4330:     nif_ioq_run([{Action, Name, N, 0}|T], State);
 4331: nif_ioq_run([{Action, Name, N, Skip}|T], State)
 4332:   when Action =:= enqv; Action =:= enqb; Action =:= enqbraw ->
 4333: 
 4334:     #{ q := IOQ, b := B } = Q = maps:get(Name, State),
 4335:     true = ioq_nif(size, IOQ) == iolist_size(B),
 4336: 
 4337:     %% Sanitize the log output a bit so that it doesn't become too large.
 4338:     H = {Action, Name, try iolist_size(N) of Sz -> Sz catch _:_ -> N end, Skip},
 4339:     ct:log("~p", [H]),
 4340: 
 4341:     Data = nif_ioq_payload(N),
 4342:     ioq_nif(Action, IOQ, Data, Skip),
 4343: 
 4344:     <<_:Skip/binary, SkippedData/binary>> = iolist_to_binary(Data),
 4345: 
 4346:     true = ioq_nif(size, IOQ) == (iolist_size([B|SkippedData])),
 4347: 
 4348:     nif_ioq_run(T, State#{ Name := Q#{ b := [B|SkippedData]}});
 4349: nif_ioq_run([{peek, Name} = H|T], State) ->
 4350:     #{ q := IOQ, b := B } = maps:get(Name, State),
 4351:     true = ioq_nif(size, IOQ) == iolist_size(B),
 4352: 
 4353:     ct:log("~p", [H]),
 4354: 
 4355:     Data = ioq_nif(peek, IOQ, ioq_nif(size, IOQ)),
 4356: 
 4357:     true = iolist_to_binary(B) == iolist_to_binary(Data),
 4358:     nif_ioq_run(T, State);
 4359: nif_ioq_run([{peek_head, Name} = H|T], State) ->
 4360:     #{ q := IOQ, b := B } = maps:get(Name, State),
 4361:     RefData = iolist_to_binary(B),
 4362: 
 4363:     ct:log("~p", [H]),
 4364: 
 4365:     {true, QueueHead} = ioq_nif(peek_head, IOQ),
 4366:     true = byte_size(QueueHead) > 0,
 4367: 
 4368:     {RefHead, _Tail} = split_binary(RefData, byte_size(QueueHead)),
 4369: 
 4370:     true = QueueHead =:= RefHead,
 4371: 
 4372:     nif_ioq_run(T, State);
 4373: nif_ioq_run([{deq, Name, all}|T], State) ->
 4374:     #{ q := IOQ, b := B } = maps:get(Name, State),
 4375:     Size = ioq_nif(size, IOQ),
 4376:     true = Size == iolist_size(B),
 4377:     nif_ioq_run([{deq, Name, Size}|T], State);
 4378: nif_ioq_run([{deq, Name, N} = H|T], State) ->
 4379:     #{ q := IOQ, b := B } = Q = maps:get(Name, State),
 4380:     true = ioq_nif(size, IOQ) == iolist_size(B),
 4381: 
 4382:     ct:log("~p", [H]),
 4383: 
 4384:     <<_:N/binary,Remain/binary>> = iolist_to_binary(B),
 4385:     NewQ = Q#{ b := Remain },
 4386: 
 4387:     Sz = ioq_nif(deq, IOQ, N),
 4388: 
 4389:     true = Sz == iolist_size(Remain),
 4390:     true = ioq_nif(size, IOQ) == iolist_size(Remain),
 4391: 
 4392:     nif_ioq_run(T, State#{ Name := NewQ });
 4393: nif_ioq_run([{create, Name} = H|T], State) ->
 4394:     ct:log("~p", [H]),
 4395:     nif_ioq_run(T, State#{ Name => #{ q => ioq_nif(create), b => [] } });
 4396: nif_ioq_run([{destroy, Name} = H|T], State) ->
 4397:     #{ q := IOQ, b := B } = maps:get(Name, State),
 4398:     true = ioq_nif(size, IOQ) == iolist_size(B),
 4399: 
 4400:     ct:log("~p", [H]),
 4401: 
 4402:     ioq_nif(destroy, IOQ),
 4403: 
 4404:     nif_ioq_run(T, maps:remove(Name, State));
 4405: nif_ioq_run([], State) ->
 4406:     State.
 4407: 
 4408: nif_ioq_payload(N) when is_integer(N) ->
 4409:     Tail = if N > 3 -> nif_ioq_payload(N-3); true -> [] end,
 4410:     Head = element(1, lists:split(N,[nif_ioq_payload(subbin),
 4411:                                      nif_ioq_payload(heapbin),
 4412:                                      nif_ioq_payload(refcbin),
 4413:                                      nif_ioq_payload(unaligned_bin) | Tail])),
 4414:     erlang:iolist_to_iovec(Head);
 4415: nif_ioq_payload(subbin) ->
 4416:     Bin = nif_ioq_payload(refcbin),
 4417:     Sz = size(Bin) - 1,
 4418:     <<_:8,SubBin:Sz/binary,_/bits>> = Bin,
 4419:     SubBin;
 4420: nif_ioq_payload(unaligned_bin) ->
 4421:     make_unaligned_binary(<< <<I>> || I <- lists:seq(1, 255) >>);
 4422: nif_ioq_payload(heapbin) ->
 4423:     <<"a literal heap binary">>;
 4424: nif_ioq_payload(refcbin) ->
 4425:     iolist_to_binary([lists:seq(1,255) || _ <- lists:seq(1,255)]);
 4426: nif_ioq_payload(Else) ->
 4427:     Else.
 4428: 
 4429: make_unaligned_binary(Bin0) ->
 4430:     Size = byte_size(Bin0),
 4431:     <<0:3,Bin:Size/binary,31:5>> = id(<<0:3,Bin0/binary,31:5>>),
 4432:     Bin.
 4433: 
 4434: pid(Config) ->
 4435:     ensure_lib_loaded(Config),
 4436:     Self = self(),
 4437:     {true, ErlNifPid} = get_local_pid_nif(Self),
 4438:     false = is_pid_undefined_nif(ErlNifPid),
 4439:     Self = make_pid_nif(ErlNifPid),
 4440: 
 4441:     UndefPid = set_pid_undefined_nif(),
 4442:     true = is_pid_undefined_nif(UndefPid),
 4443:     undefined = make_pid_nif(UndefPid),
 4444:     0 = send_term(UndefPid, message),
 4445: 
 4446:     Other = spawn(fun() -> ok end),
 4447:     {true,OtherNifPid} = get_local_pid_nif(Other),
 4448:     Cmp = compare_pids_nif(ErlNifPid, OtherNifPid),
 4449:     true = if Cmp < 0 -> Self < Other;
 4450:               Cmp > 0 -> Self > Other
 4451:            end,
 4452:     0 = compare_pids_nif(ErlNifPid, ErlNifPid),
 4453: 
 4454:     {false, _} = get_local_pid_nif(undefined),
 4455:     ok.
 4456: 
 4457: nif_term_type(Config) ->
 4458:     ensure_lib_loaded(Config),
 4459: 
 4460:     atom = term_type_nif(atom),
 4461: 
 4462:     bitstring = term_type_nif(<<1:1>>),
 4463:     bitstring = term_type_nif(<<1:8>>),
 4464: 
 4465:     float = term_type_nif(0.0),
 4466: 
 4467:     'fun' = term_type_nif(fun external:function/1),
 4468:     'fun' = term_type_nif(fun(A) -> A end),
 4469:     'fun' = term_type_nif(fun id/1),
 4470: 
 4471:     integer = term_type_nif(1 bsl 1024),        %Bignum.
 4472:     integer = term_type_nif(1),
 4473: 
 4474:     list = term_type_nif([list]),
 4475:     list = term_type_nif([]),
 4476: 
 4477:     LargeMap = maps:from_list([{N, N} || N <- lists:seq(1, 256)]),
 4478:     map = term_type_nif(LargeMap),
 4479:     map = term_type_nif(#{ small => map }),
 4480: 
 4481:     pid = term_type_nif(self()),
 4482: 
 4483:     Port = open_port({spawn,echo_drv},[eof]),
 4484:     port = term_type_nif(Port),
 4485:     port_close(Port),
 4486: 
 4487:     reference = term_type_nif(make_ref()),
 4488: 
 4489:     tuple = term_type_nif({}),
 4490: 
 4491:     ok.
 4492: 
 4493: %% Verify match state arguments are not passed to declared NIFs.
 4494: match_state_arg(Config) ->
 4495:     ensure_lib_loaded(Config),
 4496:     Bin = term_to_binary([<<"x">> | Config]), % a non-literal binary with an $x byte
 4497:     <<"nif says ok">> = msa_find_x_y(Bin),
 4498:     ok.
 4499: 
 4500: %% Without declaring msa_find_y_nif/1 as NIF, the compiler would do
 4501: %% optimization and pass it a match state as argument.
 4502: msa_find_x_y(<<$x, Rest/binary>>) ->
 4503:     msa_find_y_nif(Rest);
 4504: msa_find_x_y(<<_, Rest/binary>>) ->
 4505:     msa_find_x_y(Rest);
 4506: msa_find_x_y(<<>>) ->
 4507:     "no x".
 4508: 
 4509: msa_find_y_nif(<<$y, Rest/binary>>) ->
 4510:     Rest;
 4511: msa_find_y_nif(<<_, Rest/binary>>) ->
 4512:     msa_find_y_nif(Rest);
 4513: msa_find_y_nif(<<>>) ->
 4514:     "no y".
 4515:

 4517: last_resource_dtor_call() ->
 4518:     erts_debug:set_internal_state(wait, aux_work),
 4519:     last_resource_dtor_call_nif().
 4520:

 4522: keep_alive(Term) -> ?MODULE:id(Term).
